questions: What is the Data Science course at Moringa about?

responses: It's an interdisciplinary field focusing on algorithms, scientific methods, and processes to gain insights from data, aimed at equipping students with data analysis and storytelling skills.
Moringa's course helps you leverage data for business innovation, predict trends, analyze data, and make data-driven decisions. It's ideal for elevating or switching careers to Data Science.
The course focuses on equipping students with foundational to advanced skills in Data Science, including data analysis, machine learning, and data visualization.
It's designed for the passionately curious, those interested in data analysis, and professionals looking to switch to or elevate their careers in Data Science.
The course covers a range of topics including data storytelling, statistical analysis, machine learning, and practical applications in various industries.
Absolutely, it starts with introductory concepts, making it suitable for beginners, and progressively covers more advanced topics.
The partnership enhances the course with Flatiron School's proven curriculum and teaching methods, combining Moringa's local expertise with international standards.
You'll learn to analyze data, create data-driven insights, use popular data science tools, and develop skills in Python programming and machine learning.
What industries does the Data Science course prepare me for?
You'll learn data analysis, how to use Python for data science, storytelling with data, and developing data-driven insights for decision-making.
Absolutely, it's designed for those curious about data and includes introductory concepts suitable for beginners.
Yes, the course includes practical, hands-on learning, technical mentorship, live classes, and community learning to ensure a comprehensive understanding and application of Data Science principles

responses: The full-time course lasts for 25 weeks with 40 hours of learning per week, while the part-time course spans 35 weeks with over 20 hours of learning per week. For further info link here https://moringaschool.com/courses/data-science-course-part-time/.

The total fee for the course is Ksh 200,000 (USD 2000). Installment plans are available and can be downloaded from our website at https://moringaschool.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/Data-science-Brochure-Web.pdf.
You can visit the Moringa School website or contact their admissions team for detailed information on the fee structure.https://moringaschool.com/courses/data-science-course-part-time/
The stated fee covers the entire course. Any additional costs will be communicated upfront.
Yes, we offer installment plans to make payment more manageable for our students.
Yes, you can opt for a student loan with Aspira to finance your education.
For information on discounts or scholarships, please contact Moringa School directly.
Currently, we do not offer financial aid, but we provide flexible installment plans to ease payment.

responses: The course structure includes live lectures, technical mentorship, and hands-on projects, combining online and hybrid class options.
The curriculum includes data analysis, machine learning, data visualization, Python programming, statistical methods, and real-world applications of data science.
Yes, our curriculum is regularly updated to include the latest trends and technologies in the field of Data Science.
Yes, we have modules that cover advanced topics like deep learning, neural networks, and big data technologies.
We update our curriculum periodically to ensure it aligns with the evolving demands of the industry.
The initial phase includes an orientation, introduction to Data Science principles, and basics of Python programming.
Advanced topics include Machine Learning, Neural Networks, Deep Learning, and working with big data using PySpark and AWS.

Yes, the curriculum includes training in soft skills like project management, communication, and entrepreneurial thinking.The course involves hands-on projects, including a large-scale final data science and machine learning project.?
You'll learn to use tools like Jupyter Notebooks, Python libraries such as Numpy and Pandas, and technologies like PySpark for big data.

Certainly! The Data Science curriculum at Moringa is divided into five comprehensive phases such asPhase 0 - Orientation, Pre-Work, and Introduction to Data Science Principles: This initial phase introduces students to Moringa School, its policies, and the learning model. It covers introductory concepts in Data Science, Software Engineering Principles, and Python programming. Phase 1 - Data Analysis & Engineering: Here, students delve into Python for Data Science. They learn to use Jupyter Notebooks and familiarize themselves with key Python libraries like Numpy and Pandas, essential for data analysis and engineering. Phase 2 - Scientific Computing & Quantitative Methods: This phase focuses on the fundamentals of probability theory and scientific computing. Students apply these concepts to build their first data science model using techniques like linear regression .Phase 4 - Advanced Machine Learning: In this advanced stage, students explore unsupervised learning techniques, big data handling with PySpark and AWS, and delve into deep learning and neural networks. They also learn about sentiment analysis and other modern data science techniques. .Phase 5 - Final Data Science Projects: The curriculum culminates with students applying their technical and soft skills to create large-scale data science or machine learning projects. This phase provides an in-depth opportunity for students to demonstrate their learning accomplishments and solidify their skills.
Absolutely, our course is designed to balance theoretical knowledge with practical, hands-on experience.
